summary: Use this API to get the list of items for a range of orders1
description: Use this API to get the list of items for a range of orders1..

query.name: sort_by
query.description: Allows to choose the sorting column. Possible values are created_at and updated_at.

query.name: created_before
query.description: Limits the returned orders to those updated before or on the specified date, given in ISO 8601 date format. Optional.

query.name: created_after
query.description: Limits the returned orders to those updated after or on the specified date, given in ISO 8601 date format. Either UpdatedAfter or CreatedAfter is mandatory.

query.name: status
query.description: When set, limits the returned set of orders to loose orders, which return only entries which fit the status provided. Possible values are unpaid, pending, canceled, ready_to_ship, delivered, returned, shipped , failed, topack,toship,shipping and lost

query.name: update_before
query.description: Limits the returned orders to those updated before or on the specified date, given in ISO 8601 date format. Optional.

query.name: sort_direction
query.description: Specify the sorting type. Possible values are ASC and DESC.

query.name: offset
query.description: Number of orders to skip at the beginning of the list.

query.name: limit
query.description: The maximum number of orders that can be returned. The supported maximum number is 100.

query.name: update_after
query.description: Limits the returned orders to those updated after or on the specified date, given in ISO 8601 date format. Either UpdatedAfter or CreatedAfter is mandatory.

common.name: app_key
common.description: Unique app ID issued by LAZADA Open Platform console when you apply for an app category

common.name: timestamp
common.description: The time stamp of the request e.g. 1517820392000 (which translates to 5 February 2018 08:46:32) with less than 7200s difference from UTC time

common.name: sign_method
common.description: The HMAC hash algorithm you are using to calculate your signature

request_examples.code:
client = LazopApiClient::Client.new(url, appkey, appSecret)
request = LazopApiClient::Request.new('/orders/get','GET')
request.add_api_parameter("sort_by", "updated_at")
request.add_api_parameter("created_before", "2018-02-10T16:00:00+08:00")
request.add_api_parameter("created_after", "2017-02-10T09:00:00+08:00")
request.add_api_parameter("status", "shipped")
request.add_api_parameter("update_before", "2018-02-10T16:00:00+08:00")
request.add_api_parameter("sort_direction", "DESC")
request.add_api_parameter("offset", "0")
request.add_api_parameter("limit", "10")
request.add_api_parameter("update_after", "2017-02-10T09:00:00+08:00")
response = client.execute(request, accessToken)
puts response.success?
puts response.body

client = lazop.LazopClient(url, appkey ,appSecret)
request = lazop.LazopRequest('/orders/get','GET')
request.add_api_param('sort_by', 'updated_at')
request.add_api_param('created_before', '2018-02-10T16:00:00+08:00')
request.add_api_param('created_after', '2017-02-10T09:00:00+08:00')
request.add_api_param('status', 'shipped')
request.add_api_param('update_before', '2018-02-10T16:00:00+08:00')
request.add_api_param('sort_direction', 'DESC')
request.add_api_param('offset', '0')
request.add_api_param('limit', '10')
request.add_api_param('update_after', '2017-02-10T09:00:00+08:00')
response = client.execute(request, access_token)
print(response.type)
print(response.body)
